cardinfo.CI: Euphorbia - Indian Spurge Tree/Indian Spurge Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Indian Spurge Tree is a succulent plant with twisting columnar branches. It is often mistaken for a cactus. Leaves come out in the late summer/ fall. Flowers are small, yellow, like small buttons, alternating with the thorns, all along the stem, arranged spirally. This plant is native to India.

English: Hedge euphorbia, Oleander spurge
Bengali: Manasasi, Sij
Hindi: डंडा ठौर पेड़, थोर, Danda thaur, Danda thor, Sehund, Katathohar, Senhur, Sij, Thor
Kannada: Elegalli, Elekalli, Ilaikalli, Dubbakalli, Dundukalli elegalli, Gutagalli
Malayalam: Elakkalli, Ilaikalli, Ilakalli, Ela-calli
Marathi: Mingut, Nevagunda, Newrang, Thor, Nivarang, Seej
Odiya: Thor, Kantalothor, Svarasana
Sanskrit: Gudha, Nagarika, Nanda, Nistrinsapatra, Patrasnuhi, Adhoguda, Gandira, Guda, Mahavrksha
Tamil: இலைக்கள்ளி மரம், Elaikalli, Perumbu kalli, Ilakalli, Manjevi, Nanangalli
Telugu: Aku-jemudu, Akujamudu, Akukalli, Bonthajamudu
Urdu: Thuhar
